item.title: Brady add a quote by Gilbert Sorrentino
item.description: "A writer discovers what he knows as he knows it, i.e., as he makes it. No artist writes in order to objectify an “idea” already formed. It is the poem or novel or story that quite precisely tells him what he didn't know he knew: he knows, that is, only in terms of his writing. This is, of course, simply another way of saying that literary composition is not the placing of a held idea into a waiting form." -- Gilbert Sorrentino

item.title: Brady add a quote by Aeschylus
item.description: "I know how men in exile feed on dreams" -- Aeschylus
